website_summaries.verdict: Budget speakers that actually upgrade the power and sound output of an ATV audio system using just a few components.
pros: Three-piece kit allows you to mount the speakers individually in different places on the ATV
Can be used in tandem with other audio kits for surround sound setups
Powerful 600-watt maximum output rivals other options
cons: Included mirror mounts aren't compatible with all ATV mirrors

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy ever
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this product. A lot of reviews that got back to me said it wouldn't have enough wire that I couldn't hear when I road my bike. I have a roadking with fish tail pipes with no baffles and I can still hear my stereo on my crash bars on the road. Love this stereo
customer_reviews.author: DOZER

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: ABSOLUTE POS!! The first sign that these were gonna fail.miserably was that they were made in China. I should've returned them the second I noticed this to save me the trouble. They didn't last more than an hour without starting to pop and fail and then a week before they were completely dead aside from a noise that can only be described as robot sex. These speakers are absolute trash do not buy them. You get what you pay for but damn I expected nothing and was still disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: dont bother
customer_reviews.text: what a waste of money. someone pointed out to me after a few weeks that only one of the speakers had sound. so i tried to contact the seller about maybe getting a replacement speaker and never got a response. thanks guys -_- well, whatever, one was still working and had a decent sound. fast forward a few more weeks, driving around and all of a sudden the speaker just cuts. the amp's still getting power, all the wires are connected properly, the speakers just dont work. i'm tempted to just buy some replacement speakers and keep the amp in place, but that would mean wasting more money if it still doesnt work or just happens again.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Edited to add a 5th star. Almost 3 years and still works great. I've had this system for a month now. Very happy with the quality as well as the components. I install this on my 04 HD Dyna Super Glide and am not disappointed with the sound. I have my mp3 player at full volume and use the supplied knob for control. It has great sound till about 70 even with a full face helmet on. The wire length is long enough to properly conceal for the most part and I was able to mount the amp under the seat. I would recommend this product and I am considering purchasing another for my four wheeler.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: I don't understand the bad reviews? Unless they blow it up by hooking ...
customer_reviews.text: I've owned tow of these. I don't understand the bad reviews? Unless they blow it up by hooking it up incorrectly maybe! Both times for me it was easy to install and worked great right away. The sound quality is not amazing but it's not bad. You're making up for non-existent acoustics in the open air so loudness is more important to most of us than the nuances in the harmony. And these do have volume, no question about that. I usually use mine at about 1/4 of the full volume and sometimes turn it down from there. Ride safe!
customer_reviews.author: Joeblow

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: From the beginning I had no faith in the amp. But hoped the speakers would at least sound ok. As expected, the amp was junk. Sounded cheap and had a loud thumping sound when the amp gain was up over a 1/4. Went ahead with just the speakers installed. They have no lows. High mids and good highs. Going to keep just the speakers installed and install a cross over and make them work.
customer_reviews.author: Dicktopia

customer_reviews.title: NO BASS
customer_reviews.text: These provide ZERO Bass. I usually listen to Rock or Metal music, so i don't require a lot of bass, but some would be nice. These are better than nothing I suppose... Going to try the 4" speakers next...
customer_reviews.author: Michael E.

customer_reviews.title: 45 and under can hear it fine,  but not good past 45 for me
customer_reviews.text: I was not expecting much. After 2 days on a VTX with no windshield and V&H exhaust I wished I had not bought this. Its fine for hearing music up to 45mph without a windshield. Over 45 mph you cannot hear much more than the cymbals in the music. It also cuts out when you turn it up to its max and have the mp3 player volume max. I wished I had saved the box so I could return it. I guess it will end up on the tool box as a sort of garage stereo.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE

customer_reviews.title: Can easily hear it at highway speeds
customer_reviews.text: Installed on my 2006 Road King in April 2014. Can easily hear it at highway speeds. About a year in sound started intermittently coming out of only one speaker, traced the issue to the volume control and had to resolder the connections at the switch. Now over 2 years and the chrome is coming off of both speakers and recently one of the speaker grills popped off while in traffic on the highway. Overall I am pleased with the unit. Functioned as intended, good price. Hope that they have improved the volume control and chrome since my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Fran W.

customer_reviews.title: These are great speakers, but if you do not have them ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great speakers, but if you do not have them mounted on your handlebars close to you with a windshield to help the noise, you will not get a great quality sound. They are great looking and nice sound and not downgrading these, just wanted to help someone out before they run into what I did. I did not have windshield on and from teh direct wind hitting the ends of tehse, they faded out the chrome paint on them. So if you are going to use these, I advise using with a windshield to protect them and cut out the wind. If you have loud pipes, these are not very effective also.
customer_reviews.author: WVCWBY

customer_reviews.title: Sounds is decent.
customer_reviews.text: The sound is decent, at higher speeds you can't really hear much bass but they are loud! The the clamps around the bar was a huge pain... So they are there to stay. I wish this kit can with an on/off switch. I had to redneck up a switch. Not a bad setup for $30 tho. I'd I bought another one of these, I'd probably go with a higher power amp.
customer_reviews.author: Bill U.

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: It blew out in two months. Had them installed professionally. Amp seems to be fine. Both speakers blew out together. Now will have to get a whole new set up because it's all hard wired. It was great while it lasted I had given them high reviews. But lowered it. 2 months just seems too less of a time for it to blow out after getting them installed professionally. Had an electrician look at it, he said sometimes heat with bad or cheap speakers would do that. 2 months! Seriously Boss?
customer_reviews.author: has222

customer_reviews.title: I can hear most songs up to 80mph. I haven't tried it faster than that.
customer_reviews.text: Like the title says I can hear most songs up to 80mph on my 1997 Harley Sportster XL1200, while wearing a Hawk brand modular helmet. Short fairing on the bike. It depends on the level the MP3's were at when they were ripped from CD's, the intensity of the song, & don't forget to turn your MP3 Players volume up too to just under the Max. setting. Then use the supplied volume control. Overall I'm impressed with the speaker system, and would recommend it. 4 out of 5 stars since I'm hard to please 100%. If the volume control knob had a little more cable it may have opened up a couple more installation opportunities.
customer_reviews.author: Tim S.

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had these speakers on my 03 wide glide for a little over 9 months now. They have been cold, hot, rained on, washed, bugs splattered on them, and the still work perfectly! And sound good too! At 60mph I can still hear the music, but anything over that is just wind noise.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Good, cheap, loud.
customer_reviews.text: I bench-tested the speakers and amp before installing. I purchased an additional pigtail to go to the battery, like the one I use now for my charger, and cut and spliced that in for my connection instead of installing an inline on/off switch or locating a switched battery source. It worked out well for my needs. It is surprisingly loud and I had to adjust the EQ accordingly on my mp3 player, but that was okay by me. Cheap, easy to install (with 2 people), sounds loud, but yes, a little tinny.
customer_reviews.author: JoAQUIN tRUJILLO

customer_reviews.title: No power up after install
customer_reviews.text: Just installed the amp and it didn't power on. Contacted Boss audio waiting to see about warranty or if they want me to see if maybe I need to send it back to Amazon. After deliberating with myself and reading reviews on boss audio web site, and other people having big problems with their customer service, I decided to send the unit back to Amazon. As of yet, no email or call back from boss audio, so it's going back.
customer_reviews.author: offrdguy

customer_reviews.title: This sytem flat out rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Super sound quality! Could hear my tunes clearly on the highway at 85 mph at about 60% volume. Put the amplifier in the windshield bag and used my headlight wires as the power source instead of the battery so it only turns on when the key is turned on. mounted the speakers on my mirror stems. Oh, you will need to get a 5amp inline fuse - readily available at any autoparts store. The stereo sound quality really surprised me, especially considering the inexpensiveness of this system. Use my iPhone music and rock out as I cruise down the road. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Ron B

customer_reviews.title: good speakers, weak amp
customer_reviews.text: I installed this system as a stereo for my vintage sports car. I wanted something small that would be easy to take out or hide at car shows. I mounted the speakers under the dash where they can swing back and up out of the way when I'm not using them. I use this system in conjunction with another mono block amp powering a dash 6x9 speaker. The system sounds good around town, but can't play loud enough to enjoy on the freeway... the amp cuts out at about 3/4 volume. I will keep the speakers and buy a boss R1002 amp.
customer_reviews.author: F. Steiner

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: These speakers have stopped working! It is very frustrating due to they have been installed on our motorcycle and will have to be taken off! We do not ride that much nor have they been in weather so for them to stop working is very frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: Better than I thought
customer_reviews.text: After some basic installation, worked as well as could be expected for a motorcycle stereo. Price is great and around town speed it sounds very nice, but highway speed you only hear basic beat of the song. That's fine cause you can't hear anything on the highway anyway.....I would recommend. If I could make a suggestion to Boss Audio it would be to leave the speakers disconnected from the connection harness and put connection leads on on both harness and speaker. (if need be color code them it would make it easier to run the wires when installing)
customer_reviews.author: jimmyk

customer_reviews.title: It’s loud but has little to no bass
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great for my install. Gets louder than I’ll ever need it to but you never know. Easy to install quality looks good. I put them on my bicycle to ride the marina trail through the Bay Area on family bike rides. And to piss people off.
customer_reviews.author: Slick

customer_reviews.title: boss audio mc400 motorcycle speaker and amplifier system
customer_reviews.text: i am happy with my recent purchase of the boss audio mc400 motorcycle speaker and amplifier system, I use this system with my mp3player and fm radio, it's a small but very powerful amplifier that is easy to mount anywhere on my motorcycle, the speakers also produces a very good sound and can be mounted to the mirrors. in order to connect it to the battery, you will have to add a connecter with a crimping tool to the positive and negative wires,
customer_reviews.author: anthony harris

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money spent
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit skeptical about getting these just because of the low price tag. In the end I'm glad I got them. They came in pretty quick and the install wasn't to terribly bad. As for the sound, well first I have to say that they are better than not having any tunes on your bike. They sound very decent for the price, at about 60 and up I can't hear them very well. That could be because of where I ended up mounting them. Over all, I'm happy with my purchase and would recommend them to others
customer_reviews.author: Jaycal

customer_reviews.title: super loud.. can hear it no problem in my rzr xp 1000
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a super easy simple setup to just toss in my rzr for tunes. This little package turned out to be perfect. At full blast the sound gets distorted..but you really gotta have it super cranked to do that, I can hear it no problem just below the loudest setting.. and who cares.. it was 50 bucks for the setup. I will probably add in better speakers at some point.. I think the amp is fine..it's just the speakers being semi cheap..but they work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Eric F.

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound System for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sound system for the price. My kuryakyn "Sound of Chrome" died after 6 years and I replaced that $400 sound system with this $50 system from Amazon. The installation is not as clean, and you have to install an inline fuse, also an on/off switch is good. Otherwise the installation was easy and the sound is nearly as clear as the Sound of Chrome, and a LOT louder! Easy to hear at 70+ mph. Overall it is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AMP dead after a month - SPEAKERS ARE NOW USELESS
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about a month, then all of a sudden the amplifier went out. I used a meter and ran several test on the wires, making sure it wasn't a power issue, and the unit was still getting power. The amplifier simply died. Without the amp, this product is worthless. Extremely disappointed. Like others have suggested, spend a little more money and get something of better quality. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: flori

customer_reviews.title: Best buy ever.
customer_reviews.text: If you are tired of wearing ear plugs these speekers are the best. I love to ride with my music now. Me and my girl love to step off the bike and so some salsa dance and then keep riding. People think we are nuts but who doesn't love to have fun while ridding. The speekers were easy to install. There is no power button so I plugged them to my lights. So that when my bike turns on they turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Aguilar Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my UTV (Arctic Cat Wildcat Sport) and it works great. The only issue I have is the wires are short, speaker wires are about 4 feet. I had to mount the unit in my center console, wires not long enough to reach the dash. To mount the speaker on my cage I had to cut and splice in wiring. The sound quality is better than I expected and the volume is very good, easy to hear.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stereo for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to install on a KLR 650. The install was a little tricky finding a place to mount the amp that would remain dry, but also had the needed airflow for cooling. Once the install was complete I was seriously impressed with the sound quality for how much it cost. The only negative was lack of Bass, but I will definitely purchase another one for another project.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Sounds amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before buying and I'm extremely happy that I decided on these. YouTube had a few very helpful videos from bikers that displayed the speakers nicely. In excess I ordered fork clamps to place the speakers to the sides of my bike just below and in front of the tank. This spot doesn't interfere with the fork movement and it's also a bit more discreet than placed up on the handlebars. Buy this item and you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sage Law of Literally Magic™

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the worst sounding system I've ever heard and I've always had good luck with boss products. You can't hear anything over 50mph and the sound quality is terrible even when your sitting still
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Delancey

customer_reviews.title: Great little system!
customer_reviews.text: Great system! Great price!I installed these on a Honda Silverwing Scooter. Speaker housings are plastic, but they are waterproof. The amp is small enough to fit in the glove box. I installed a switch and fuse and wired directly into the battery. The sound is decent for the price. There is some distortion when turned all the way up, but I hardly have to run them wide open. Great quality wiring harness, solid speakers and amp. I would buy them again!
customer_reviews.author: DRegio

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, even in rain.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great. Very loud, so loud it distorts when too high. but you can definitely hear it at highway speeds if you want to. I've had it through 3 downpours and I haven't noticed any difference in looks or quality. I have it hooked up to a toggle so I can play music without the key turned, and it has lasted over an hour without draining the battery. Good luck finding a decent hidden mounting place for the amp.
customer_reviews.author: Justin G

customer_reviews.title: Out performs other budget speakers, underwelms midgrade
customer_reviews.text: Updated review: Sorry guys, my second set this season stopped working. Save your $$$, 2x$40 in 5 months... I should have just invested $200-400 in a set that will last. Original Review: Budget kit, worked great during my first long trip (400 miles)... Then they slowly stopped performing. First I lost output to one speaker, then the whole thing just gave up. For $40, its worth another try, I'll be ordering another one (this time with Bluetooth). My neighbor has one and his has lasted an entire season.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Domko

customer_reviews.title: Put this on my Honda chopper and it sounds great. 70 MPH and volume is set about 60%
customer_reviews.text: Put this on my Honda chopper and it sounds great. 70 MPH and volume is set about 60%.. Bolted speakers to either side of speedometer and put amp in tool bag. The volume control is wire tied to handlebar by left grip. Easy to adjust volume. I have my Sandisc MP3 player clipped to wires by volume control. Awesome set-up.
customer_reviews.author: lee ferrese

customer_reviews.title: They are awesome, installed on 2011 yamaha road star silverado s ...
customer_reviews.text: They are awesome, installed on 2011 yamaha road star silverado s and can hear them easily at 75 b4 they start to get hidden by cobra pipes, only problem is bar mounts need to be a little heavier
customer_reviews.author: Tom chambers

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: This unit has great reviews and i can see why. Really good sound and seems well made. The volume control is great design. I zip tied it to the throttle cable housing and let it protrude about 3/4 inch. You can adjust with your thumb very easily. It has PLENTY of volume. It does take some time and skill to install due to the wiring that must be routed and hidden. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Freeman

customer_reviews.title: good  buy for 50 dollars ish
customer_reviews.text: not the best sound you can get but for the money the style and volume is really pretty darned good. I paid about $46.00 for 2, one for a gift, and then bought one more for a project. (all bicycles) The last one was almost $60. That is the limit I would pay because I can build a better one for far less from parts on amazon, but this does look good and sounds good. tough to hide this much wiring on a bicycle though...
customer_reviews.author: Bike guy

customer_reviews.title: Blow your helmet off.
customer_reviews.text: I must say, I read some of the rating on this prior to me purchasing this system. I have a 2009 Susuki C50T and these speakers would blow my ears out even inside my helmet. At high speeds these speakers sound great. The install was easy. It took my about 30 minutes to get it completed. The only thing I would advise is to include the fusable link with the kit instead of spending the extra time going to the parts house to buy one. I hope these hold out through the long trips I take with this bike. Sounds good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Barker

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Lone this set up, especially for the price. I have a loud bike and I can adjust the volume and hear the music when I’m going 50 on up to 80 mph with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: No

customer_reviews.title: Crap. Pure crap.
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are crap. The “chrome” has already faded within four months. The unit, even with a toggle switch to the battery still didn’t stop it from draining my battery. The sound quality is horrible if you want it loud enough to hear over a Harley stop exaust at 45MPH. Used them for two days. Never again. Save your money and get something better.
customer_reviews.author: Hammer

customer_reviews.title: Good and loud plug ur phone in or and external ...
customer_reviews.text: Have these on an atv I take past the handle bars in mud and water. Where these are mounted and they have been there 6 months now and I have been on a lot of rides with them and just washed off with a pressure washer. Good and loud plug ur phone in or and external radio it has its own amp and volume control.
customer_reviews.author: Koby Owens

customer_reviews.title: Not too hard to install sounds great ever at freeway speeds mounted speakers behind my windshield ...
customer_reviews.text: Not too hard to install sounds great ever at freeway speeds mounted speakers behind my windshield on my road king Also had to buy p-clamps with rubber to use under the clamp the speakers came with because they were to big and to Protect my handle bars from scratching you can get p-clamps at most hardware stores
customer_reviews.author: John Gamez

customer_reviews.title: After about 2 hours of use I've changed my 5 star rating to a 1 star.
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Plenty of volume. Not much bass response but that is normal for small speaks. Next day shipping was awesome. Item was at my door by 9:30 on Saturday morning. UPDATE. After 2 hours of use, one speaker started popping loudly at moderate volume levels and other speaker is buzzing. I should have paid more attention to the 1 star reviews before wasting my money and time. Seems to be typical of this product. I'm not going to give Boss Audio another $20.00 for warranty return shipping. They obviously have an issue with these and I'm not going to waste another dime for more of the same defective merchandise.
customer_reviews.author: DLP

customer_reviews.title: these speakers work excellent so far
customer_reviews.text: POSITIVE:these speakers are EXTREMELY LOUD NEGATIVE: the amp box gets hot after a few hours of extended use, suggest mounting amp box somewhere with air flow.. these speakers work excellent so far. i have not tested the waterproof ability tho.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: The sound is better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived intact. The installation on my motorcycle went fairly smooth. I mounted the speakers first then wired up the amplifier to the battery/fuse and connected everything, secured the amplifier and tightened everything. The sound is better than I expected, nice and clear. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Ron Mobley

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to a joy ride
customer_reviews.text: Good product wish it had its own reciver so you don’t have to hook up to it with a phone/ iPod
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Bitker

customer_reviews.title: used to have the Harley Davidson speakers paid 300 for them was never able to here my music over 60 mph now I can hear it up to
customer_reviews.text: l LOVEthese speakers I have a heritage softail, used to have the Harley Davidson speakers paid 300 for them was never able to here my music over 60 mph now I can hear it up to 75+ mph and didn't cost a fraction of the HD ones best buy I've made all year
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn E Hedrick

customer_reviews.title: 1 star
customer_reviews.text: Originally out of the box awesome. But 2 months later blown both speakers. So my advice do not but these knock offs.
customer_reviews.author: Mr n mrs DeStefano

customer_reviews.title: IF YOU HAVE A PROBLEM WITH YOUR MC400 DON'T EVEN ...
customer_reviews.text: IF YOU HAVE A PROBLEM WITH YOUR MC400 DON'T EVEN BOTHER TO TRY TO BUY A PART YOU WILL BE TOLD YOU HAVE TO SEND THE PART TO BOSS AND THEY WILL CHECK IT OUT. YOU HAVE TO DISABLE THE WHOLE SYSTEM WHAT A SHAME TO HEAR THIS I HAVE PURCHASED 4 OF THESE SYSTEMS AND CANNOT PURCHASE THE PART I NEED. NO MORE BOSS AUDIO SYSTEMS !!!!!!!!BOB WAGNER
customer_reviews.author: barbara w.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on this not knowing if it would sound ok. But is does sound great. Lots of volume and good sound quaility for small speakers. The speaker housings are made of plastic and scratches very easy. It comes with a volume control knob but no way to mount it. The knob doesn't come off so you can't drill a hole in a bracket and mount it. I have it zip tied where I can reach it. That is my only complaint. Time will tell if it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: techmike99

customer_reviews.title: Great item, Great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I looked a a few install videos to ensure I could install myself. The whole install was 2.5 hours with 1.5 being the speaker install. Clams could be better, that's why it's not 5 stars but the sound is unbelievable even at 60mph. You can't go wrong for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Namon

customer_reviews.title: nice system price is right.
customer_reviews.text: So I've had these on the motorcycles for about a month now. They were easy to install and sound awesome on the bikes. I've run both the bikes up to 85 and can still hear the tunes. Half volume at 65mph no problem and then a little higher over 65 but no worries. Sounds great. My bikes don't see the rain hardly ever. So I can't speak to the water resistant part but I'm sure that is fine as well. I recommend this system to anyone who wants tunes in their motorcycle rides.
customer_reviews.author: Jerbels

customer_reviews.title: LOUD LOUD LOUD
customer_reviews.text: LOUD! Mounted under the mirrors on my Road King, looks good and sounds awesome. I would give a 5, except it did not come with the clamp style handlebar brackets and customer service at Boss said that they are on back order. Also, the pictures of the rotary volume control leave a lot to the imagination. It is made to mount in a panel with double jamb nuts. All in all, we took our time and hid all of the wires for a really clean install and this thing sounds awesome. I think it rivals the upgraded speakers in my buddy's Street Glide.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Cogar

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's nice being able to listen to the music as I cruise down the road! Works pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: james f sumner

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Stereo For My Cruiser !
customer_reviews.text: Wish they had 6 stars for this motorcycle stereo! Works better, sounds better than the $400.00 stereo I had on a previous bike! This stereo is way too good for this low price! Extremely satisfied! And if you're wondering, I hear it clearly on my Roadliner at 70+ MPH!!
customer_reviews.author: Bigsteve113

customer_reviews.title: easy mounting, easy to hook up to the battery ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a Heritage Softail Classic, put them on the bars, easy mounting, easy to hook up to the battery and they sound great, actuallly run them at about 1/2 volume
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2007 Yamaha Road Star Silverado 1700. I mounted these on the side view mirror stems. I use my HTC Evo 4G phone for the music and navigation. Amplifier and speakers work great. I listen while on I75 on my way to work, 75 - 85 MPH. Friends can not believe what I paid for them. Only down side is stator noise back thru the power system. I installed a filter, which helped.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M. Schulter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this at first but after reading some of the reviews I thought I would give it a try. Love it.. Sounds great and was easy to install. I don’t even put the volume on full going down the highway at 65 mph. Also I took the power wire to my 10amp fuse on the ignition and so when you turn your bike off the system shuts down as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: figured out it was a bad jack connection and once I knew that was the ...
customer_reviews.text: Honestly had some issues at first. The right speaker kept cutting out. figured out it was a bad jack connection and once I knew that was the problem, I re-seated the jack and works great. I hooked up to the ignition switch and also added a toggle because of the draw on the battery on start-up. Now I turn on the bike, start it up and then flip the toggle for the amp, once the bike is running. Only 4 stars because the clamps are a nightmare to put on and ugly. I bought a separate set of Shark chrome mounts to use.
customer_reviews.author: richard hart

customer_reviews.title: 000 miles and sounds pretty good. Base is not the best sounding
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 2 years but one mount broke this year while I was riding. Lasted about 12,000 miles and sounds pretty good. Base is not the best sounding.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremu

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good sound for the price, but the aux cord never lasts, so I'd go with the wireless ones unless you wanna keep replacing the cord
customer_reviews.author: Teig

customer_reviews.title: Seeing that it doesn't have an on/off switch I initially ...
customer_reviews.text: Seeing that it doesn't have an on/off switch I initially wired it into my brake lights power wire. It worked, but with a lot of static, especially when the music was off. After trying a few different things, I bought a handle bar mounted on / off switch. I wired the amp, both positive and negative directly to the battery, then through the inline fuse, then to the switch. Works perfectly now. No static and I'm no longer running the amp constantly which I'm sure will extend it's life. Buy the handle bar switch when you buy the stereo. Do it right the first time and save yourself the trouble that I went through.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W Andrade

customer_reviews.title: Listen Up
customer_reviews.text: This item was very easy to install. The quality for the price is very good. It's not as loud as I thought it would be for the amperage it claims to have but it is plenty loud. This item is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: madmac742

customer_reviews.title: So far so good kind of hard to hear when cruising over 55 ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good kind of hard to hear when cruising over 55 but I don't have a windshield and have them mounted low on my hangers. Better than I expected for the price and a pretty simple install. Only got 4 stars because the clamps are kind of crap but they work
customer_reviews.author: Snack daddy

customer_reviews.title: Stoped working
customer_reviews.text: Didnt last got it for motorcycle and stopped working. I opened up a ticket with boss and nothing happened. I'm still waiting and it's been a couple weeks
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Colcord

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Just as ordered. Matches motorcycle chrome perfectly. When riding above 65mph on I95 the soumd is hard to hear on max and distorted, but it matches the price. I will be upgrading since i spend so much time ridiing. Also, i have a big cruiser (1998 Honda Valkyrie) and the speaker wires could be about 6 inches longer for a perfect fit. No instructions but straightforward install aboit 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A.

customer_reviews.title: Skip it
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these speakers Oct of 2015. Delivery was fast. Sound was great for the money. I would have rated four or five stars but the speakers blew about a month ago. Probably no chance of getting a new one or a refund now so I can't recommend this to anyone. Surprised they blew. I never turned it all the way up.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Elaine Ledbetter

customer_reviews.title: Sound is Good
customer_reviews.text: Works really good , main cable was a little short but I made it work, other than that they work great so far !!!
customer_reviews.author: William Cochrane

customer_reviews.title: Sound great.
customer_reviews.text: Installed them on my C90 suzuki, went on vacation. They sounded great, using with my Ipod. It was all going really well for about 3 hours, until the stator went on my motorcycle. Drawing to much power. After a two hundred mile tow (thank you CAA), vacation ending early, and two hundred dollars plus for me to install a new stator, my bike runs well again. They are know sitting in the original box. There's nothing wrong with these speakers or amp, but make sure your motorcycle can handle them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its great but
customer_reviews.text: It has no on or off switch so if you listen to the instructions it says use battery to power it. I recommend using ignition power.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: good sound. Note on a Harley with loud pipes ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well, good sound. Note on a Harley with loud pipes you can only use it up to roughly 25 mph. Wind noise and exhaust sound after that and there is simply nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Robert S. Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Great Volume
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in a Rhino clone UTV. It works great, volume is loud with no distortion, but when I hooked it up to an MP3 player it sounded a little "tinny." Luckily, I have an equalizer on my phone and that helped increase the bass. I would recommend using a device source with an equalizer.
customer_reviews.author: Russ P

customer_reviews.title: makes long rides a little more fun.
customer_reviews.text: Clean sound, loud enough to hear at 70+ mph without distorting, makes long rides a little more fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, amazing sound. Not much base but that's fine
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Boss Audio MC400
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased the Boss system as a filler while I saved the money to purchase a fairing with stereo, but I am so impressed with these little speakers that I might keep them instead. The speakers are loud enough even at highway speeds, but I do have a windshield. I didn't mount the speakers on the mirrors because they would just look silly there. I bought chrome brackets and put on handle bars. I have a C90T, so space was limited as far as mounting amp, so I just added a kill switch and put the entire unit in the windshield bag. You won't be disappointed with these little speakers. I have receive numerous compliments on sound and look.
customer_reviews.author: Stanford B.

customer_reviews.title: ... later brother still brags to his buddies about how great his boat speakers are
customer_reviews.text: 2 years later brother still brags to his buddies about how great his boat speakers are. Nice product and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Adam L.

customer_reviews.title: Wow these are great...
customer_reviews.text: They look great and sound even better. They are easy to install and hooks right up to my droid phone. The look great on the bike if you have a larger cruiser on a smaller bike they may be too much. I plan to order several more of these for other uses like my golf cart and car hauler enclosed trailer...
customer_reviews.author: WM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent speakers for the money
customer_reviews.text: Excellent speakers for the money. They don't sound awesome without some help. Get an eq for your phone. They go from ok speakers to great ones. Attaching the speakers to the bar was a 2 person job. I would buy again!!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Casto

customer_reviews.title: WOW.......Best Value for what you get!!
customer_reviews.text: The sound that these speakers produce have exceeded my expectation for the amount of money that was spent. Install time took about an hour. I recommmend you plan your installation route and connections ahead of time. I installed these on a 2005 Harley Sportster 1200C. I utilized the supplied brackets by attaching to the Lower windshield mounts. I have a friend that installed a $400 system that side by side can hear no discernible differnce in the sound quality. Really Pisses him off! I wear a 1/2 helmet and have no issue whatsoever hearing my tunes at 1/2 volume at any speed. If your looking for great affordable sound these are the ticket! Will post pics
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Donnelly

customer_reviews.title: A got to have item!
customer_reviews.text: This was better than what I was thinking. The sound was great and very clear with alittle bass as well. Very impressed with this unit. The wires could have been alittle longer, it was a sintch to hook up and you're winning with the price of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Troy G.

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Seller stores123
customer_reviews.text: Less than one week after installing the left speaker began distorting sound and stopped working all together!! Contacted the seller and was told, "Unfortunately, that is not something we can assist you with. " Really??
customer_reviews.author: NGT RDR

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 4 hours.... then dead.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 4 hours, then just hissing. Checked all my wires to make sure nothing was crushed. Amp appears to have blown the channel after only 1 ride.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: I have purchased one years ago and it worked great right up until the time I sold the bike ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at October for a Christmas present we put it on in May and it already stopped working there's absolutely no volume coming out of it. I have purchased one years ago and it worked great right up until the time I sold the bike with it on it I would love to get it exchanged so that I have one that works.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff burger

customer_reviews.title: great sound on my 1999 V Star Custom my bike ...
customer_reviews.text: great sound on my 1999 V Star Custom my bike is louder that dads Harley and i can hear it clear as a bell I have told people about these unit because of price and the great sound and have had 5 other people buy them great buy
customer_reviews.author: newhigherlevel

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Cake Installation.
customer_reviews.text: The overall performance and quality for this price is just awesome. 50 bucks is a great price. I did have to pick up some handlebar mounts because on my bike (99 Indian Chief). I could not mount the right speaker on the mirror mount because of the Brake Reservoir. Mirror shafts are to short. Added an on/off switch and fuse. Great Deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Pete E. Haddad

customer_reviews.title: The sound is awesomely great..
customer_reviews.text: The sound is awesomely great. ... but there's no bass so choose your music well... overall I can hear it at 70mph and my pipes are loud
customer_reviews.author: Heru AhmenRa

customer_reviews.title: great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Good sound! Came with the mounts for the bars... not the mirror mounts... they fit my 1.25" bars. I mounted them low on my crash bars tho, to keep my handle bars less cluttered... the sound isn't as loud obviously because they aren't at ear level, although I did test them on my handle bars. Sound great when mounted at ear level With power to spare.. I prefer looks over sound, so I went with the more aesthetic mount.. over all, even down low, at under 60 mph you get great clear sound! Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Glen Barrett

customer_reviews.title: As good as other reviews stated!!!
customer_reviews.text: Put these speakers on my 2002 HD Heritage Classic with Screamin Eagle II pipes and they sound fantastic. Do have them behind windshield but have been riding with full face helmet and can still hear even 55 mph+. Can't wait to hear them with my half-helmet. Would highly recommend and the price cannot be touched by anyone else. Saved several hundred over what's offered by HD and these look great as well. Even have a bluetooth adapter that works great as well. Buy these if you want good tunes on your bike.
customer_reviews.author: Terry B.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but no bass
customer_reviews.text: Great sound but no bass... Very lound on my Honda Stateline..Long wires and easy to install.... Great product.. i base my purchase on how many reviews and stars it had... This is not a radio, no bluetooth... its just speakers wires, amp, fuse... easy money... amp is easy to hide and very small... hid it in a empty cover at the battery hidden in the bike....
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Mcgowen

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: good product ... use some extra electrical tape to keep from getting wet and wires rubbing
customer_reviews.author: Scott W.

customer_reviews.title: Mines mounted on handle bars out in the weather and have had no issues in 2 years!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent stereo system. Sounds great even at high speeds. Only drawback is gf can't hear it very well at highway speeds with my 2 up seat. Otherwise love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bass is not good but not bad sound quality for the price
customer_reviews.author: laChelle

customer_reviews.title: Bummer unit
customer_reviews.text: Constant battery killer. It worked great but theres no way to cut the current from the unit even when the volume button is all the way off. eventually got frustrated with it and trashed it
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Awesome System!!!
customer_reviews.text: Other than a couple of mounting complaints this is an awesome sound system for the money. Sounds good for $50 speakers even at 75 MPH and it looks good but I wish the speakers and amp had more mounting options. I plan to make some custom modifications of my own design to improve the mounting but overall I got exactly what I was hoping for. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a stereo for their motorcycle. I mounted this system to a 2008 Harley Davidson Sportster 883C Custom. Install time was about 2 hours with an on/off auxiliary switch ordered from HD.com.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Darnell

customer_reviews.title: Boss audio MC400
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional sound. Had a Pyle 100W prior. Absolutely no comparison. I can now hear my tunes well below maximum volume. Price was great too.
customer_reviews.author: neil beck

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The original set lasted 8 months, then one of the speakers was blown. Got a replacement set under the warranty, and within 6 months one of the speakers blew out, an monthly later both were dead. The one year warranty had past, so they ended up in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Tor Rehrig

customer_reviews.title: Good system for money
customer_reviews.text: You need to turn bass down if u don't want any distortion. Speakers put out pretty good sound, i installed item on my Seadoo GTX. So far so good, installation took about 1hr. Item comes ready for install out the box.
customer_reviews.author: LUIS JARA

customer_reviews.title: Great investment! !!!!!!!!  Well worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE these speakers I have an 03 shadow 1100 with the baffles cut out and regardless of speed I have zero issues being able to hear my music the quality of the music/device u use makes a big difference in the clarity of the speakers.. and for the cost I'd buy them every time.... plug it into my phone and off I go !!!!! I wired mine up to a switch so I can control the power as I please versus them coming on when I turn the key
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I couldn't afford the full fairing with stereo that I wanted. Speakers are a bit large and only have one mounting option. The sound is amazing. I took the bike out in a 40 mph wind going 70mph and it was crystal clear. If I could ask for two things from Boss it would be a more flexible mounting system and better instructions for where to tie in to the wiring. I ended up on a line that is always hot so I had to add a switch to turn off the amp and save my battery. Not a big thing, just something extra I had to do. Over all very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Dills

product_meta.title: Boss Audio Systems MC400 Motorcycle Speaker System - Class D Compact Amplifier, 3 Inch Weatherproof Speakers, Volume Control, Great for Use with ATVs-Motorcycles-12 Volt Vehicles
product_meta.description:
Max out your playlists while you ride the roads or the trails with the Boss Audio MC400 Chrome Weatherproof Motorcycle Sound System. Power up your music on your 12V Motorcycle, Scooter or ATV with the 600 Watt Max Power Amp and a pair of 3" Full Range Speakers. Hook your Smartphone or MP3 Player up to the Auxiliary Input. Turn up the sound with the Wired Remote Volume Control. The MC400 features Weatherproof Speakers to provide protection against the elements. For high quality sound on the go, fire up the Boss Audio MC400.Overheating of the amplifier can cause the audio to cut out or clip. Install in a well ventilated location and away from any direct exposure to the sun. 

For further product details, please scroll down.
feature_bullets: Speakers Powered By High Performance, 2 Channel, Compact, Weatherproof Class A/B Amplifier
3.5 mm Aux-In Compatible with Audio Output of iPod / iPhone, Smartphones and MP3 Players
Included: Two 3 Inch Chrome Speakers, One 2 Channel Amplifier, One Inline Volume Control, Adjustable Brackets Fit Handlebars from .75” to 1.25”
Ideal for Motorcycles, ATV's, UTV's, Scooters, And Other 12 Volt Applications
Speaker Dimensions: 4.8 x 4 x 6.1, Amplifier Dimensions: 3.2 x 3.1 x 1.5 inches

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,213 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
